section.heading: Definitions.

content.p: As used in this chapter, unless the context otherwise requires, the words and terms defined inNRS 209.021to209.085, inclusive, have the meanings ascribed to them in those sections.

section.heading: ï¿½Boardï¿½ defined.

content.p: ï¿½Boardï¿½ means the Board of State Prison Commissioners as defined bySection 21 of Article 5of the Nevada Constitution.

section.heading: ï¿½Classificationï¿½ defined.

content.p: ï¿½Classificationï¿½ means the process of individual case evaluation to determine the custody and program needs of the individual offender.

section.heading: ï¿½Custodyï¿½ defined.

content.p: ï¿½Custodyï¿½ means the level of security restrictions imposed on an offender by a classification committee.

section.heading: ï¿½Departmentï¿½ defined.

content.p: ï¿½Departmentï¿½ means the Department of Corrections.

section.heading: ï¿½Directorï¿½ defined.

content.p: ï¿½Directorï¿½ means the Director of the Department.

authorialNote.p: ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ (Added to NRS by1977, 845; A2001 Special Session, 192)

section.heading: Disciplinary segregationï¿½ defined.

content.p: ï¿½Disciplinary segregationï¿½ means the separation of an offender from the general population for a specified period of time when an offender has committed a serious violation of the rules of a facility or institution.

section.heading: ï¿½Facilityï¿½ defined.

content.p: ï¿½Facilityï¿½ means a community correctional center, conservation camp, facility of minimum security or other place of confinement, other than an institution, operated by the Department for the custody, care or training of offenders.

section.heading: Gender non-binaryï¿½ defined.

content.p: ï¿½Gender non-binaryï¿½ means a person whose gender identity does not conform to the traditional gender binary of male and female.

section.heading: Gender non-conformingï¿½ defined.

content.p: ï¿½Gender non-conformingï¿½ means a person whose gender characteristics or behaviors do not conform to those characteristics or behaviors traditionally associated with the biological sex of the person.

section.heading: General populationï¿½ defined.

content.p: ï¿½General populationï¿½ means the status of offenders who are incarcerated and do not have a special status, including, without limitation, a status of solitary confinement.

section.heading: ï¿½Institutionï¿½ defined.

content.p: ï¿½Institutionï¿½ means a prison designed to house 125 or more offenders within a secure perimeter.

section.heading: Intersexï¿½ defined.

content.p: ï¿½Intersexï¿½ means a condition in which a person is born with external genitals, internal reproductive organs, chromosome patterns or an endocrine system that does not conform to the traditional gender binary of male or female.

section.heading: ï¿½Managerï¿½ defined.

content.p: ï¿½Managerï¿½ means the administrative officer in charge of a facility.

section.heading: ï¿½Medical Directorï¿½ defined.

content.p: ï¿½Medical Directorï¿½ means the designated administrative officer of the Department who is responsible for the medical treatment of offenders.

section.heading: ï¿½Offenderï¿½ defined.

content.p: ï¿½Offenderï¿½ means any person convicted of a crime under the laws of this State and sentenced to imprisonment in the state prison.

section.heading: ï¿½Private facility or institutionï¿½ defined.

content.p: ï¿½Private facility or institutionï¿½ means a facility or institution operated by a private organization to house prisoners.

section.heading: Serious mental illness or other significant mental impairmentï¿½ defined.

content.p: ï¿½Serious mental illness or other significant mental impairmentï¿½ means: ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
A mental, behavioral or emotional disorder that results in serious functional impairment, which substantially interferes with or limits one or more major life activities; or ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
A diagnosis of an intellectual disability, as defined inNRS 435.007. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

The term includes, without limitation, a diagnosis of major depression, schizophrenia, bipolar disorder, obsessive-compulsive disorder, panic disorder, post-traumatic stress disorder or borderline personality disorder.

section.heading: Solitary confinementï¿½ defined.

content.p: Protection of: ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
The health or safety of the offender from other offenders; or ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
The life or property of the staff or other offenders; or ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Security or orderly operation of the facility or institution.

section.heading: Transgenderï¿½ defined.

content.p: ï¿½Transgenderï¿½ means a person whose gender identity or expression differs from the sex assigned to the person at birth.

section.heading: ï¿½Wardenï¿½ defined.

content.p: ï¿½Wardenï¿½ means the administrative officer in charge of an institution.

section.heading: Department created; Board of State Prison Commissioners.

content.p: The Department of Corrections is hereby created. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
The head of the Department is the Board of State Prison Commissioners. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
The Governor is the President of the Board. The Secretary of State is the Secretary of the Board. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Any two members of the Board constitute a quorum for the transaction of business. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

The Director: ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

content.p: Administer the Department under the direction of the Board. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Supervise the administration of all institutions and facilities of the Department. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Receive, retain and release, in accordance with law, offenders sentenced to imprisonment in the state prison. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Be responsible for the supervision, custody, treatment, care, security and discipline of all offenders under his or her jurisdiction. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Ensure that any person employed by the Department whose primary responsibilities are: ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
The security and safety of the staff; and ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
The security and safety of an institution or facility of the Department, ï¿½is a correctional officer who has the powers of a peace officer pursuant to subsection 1 ofNRS 289.220. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

Provide for the holding of religious services in the institutions and facilities and make available to the offenders copies of appropriate religious materials. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Compile the last known residential address of each offender immediately before the offender was sentenced to imprisonment in a facility or institution of the Department.

section.heading: Director: Training of correctional staff.

content.p: The Director may continue to develop and implement, in each institution and facility of the Department, a program of facility training for the correctional staff. Such training must include: ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Training in evidence-based practices, including, without limitation, principles of effective intervention, effective case management and core correctional practices; ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Courses on interacting with victims of domestic violence and trauma and people with behavioral health needs and both physical and intellectual disabilities; and ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Training in cultural competency for interacting with offenders who are transgender, gender non-conforming, gender non-binary and intersex. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

The Director shall develop and implement, in each institution and facility of the Department in which an offender may be placed in solitary confinement, a program of training for any correctional staff of the facility or institution who interact with offenders placed in solitary confinement. Such training must include, without limitation, training in effective communication, crisis intervention and de-escalation techniques. Any training required to be completed pursuant to a program of training adopted pursuant to this subsection is in addition to any other training required to be completed by correctional staff.

content.p: Except as otherwise provided in subsection 2, in addition to his or her regular salary, each person employed by the Department of Corrections or the Division of Forestry of the State Department of Conservation and Natural Resources at the Southern Nevada Correctional Center, the Southern Desert Correctional Center, the Indian Springs Conservation Camp, the correctional institution identified as the Menï¿½s Prison No. 7 in chapter 656, Statutes of Nevada 1995, and chapter 478, Statutes of Nevada 1997, or the Jean Conservation Camp is entitled to receive, as compensation for travel expenses, not more than $7.50 for each day he or she reports to work if his or her residence is more than 25 miles from the respective institution or facility. section.heading: Fund for Prison Industries.

content.p: The Fund for Prison Industries is hereby created as an enterprise fund to receive all revenues derived from programs for vocational training and employment of offenders and the operation of the prison farm and to receive all revenues raised by the Department from private employers for the leasing of space, facilities or equipment within the institutions or facilities of the Department. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

The interest and income earned on the money in the Fund, after deducting any applicable charges, must be credited to the Fund. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

section.heading: Offendersï¿½ Store Fund; statement of offenderï¿½s financial situation; criminal penalties relating to concealment of assets and provision of false or misleading financial information.

content.p: The Offendersï¿½ Store Fund is hereby created as a special revenue fund. All money received for the benefit of offenders through contributions, and from other sources not otherwise required to be deposited in another fund, must be deposited in the Offendersï¿½ Store Fund. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

The Director shall cause the Offendersï¿½ Store Fund to be reimbursed from the offenderï¿½s individual account in the Prisonersï¿½ Personal Property Fund, as money becomes available. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

If the Department incurs costs related to state property that has been willfully damaged, destroyed or lost or incurs costs related to medical examination, diagnosis or treatment for an injury to an offender, the Director may authorize the State Controller to transfer money from the Offendersï¿½ Store Fund to the appropriate account in the State General Fund to repay or defray those costs if: ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
The Director has reason to believe that an offender caused the damage, destruction, loss or injury; and ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

The identity of the offender is unknown or cannot be determined by the Director with reasonable certainty. ï¿½The State Controller shall make the transfer if authorized by the Director. Any money transferred must be accounted for separately. If the identity of the offender is determined after money has been transferred, the Director shall cause the Offendersï¿½ Store Fund to be reimbursed from the offenderï¿½s individual account in the Prisonersï¿½ Personal Property Fund, as money becomes available. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

The Director may, with approval of the Board, establish by regulation a charge on the purchase of electronic devices by offenders to defray the costs relating to the operation of the devices. Any regulations adopted pursuant to this subsection must be adopted in accordance with the provisions ofchapter 233Bof NRS. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

The Director may, with approval of the Board, establish by regulation a charge on the use by offenders of videoconferencing equipment for conducting visits to defray the costs relating to the operation and maintenance of the equipment. If an offender who has been assigned to a center for the purpose of making restitution is returned to an institution for committing an infraction of the regulations of the Department and the center has not been fully compensated for the cost of providing the offender with housing, transportation, meals, or medical or dental services at the center, the Director may authorize the State Controller to transfer money from the Offendersï¿½ Store Fund to the appropriate account in the State General Fund to repay or defray those costs. The Director shall cause the Offendersï¿½ Store Fund to be reimbursed from the offenderï¿½s individual account in the Prisonersï¿½ Personal Property Fund, as money becomes available. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

If an offender has insufficient money in his or her individual account in the Prisonersï¿½ Personal Property Fund to repay or defray costs assessed to the offender pursuant toNRS 209.246, the offender shall sign a statement under penalty of perjury concerning his or her financial situation. Such a statement must include, but is not limited to, the following information: ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
The assets in any bank account of the offender; and ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

An offender who conceals assets from the Department or provides false or misleading information on a statement prepared pursuant to this section is guilty of a gross misdemeanor. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

The Director: ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

The monthly statement described in subsection 3: ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

section.heading: Administrative claim by prisoner for loss of personal property, property damage, personal injuries or other claims; regulations.

content.p: A prisoner or former prisoner may file an administrative claim with the Department to recover compensation for the loss of his or her personal property, property damage, personal injuries or any other claim arising out of a tort alleged to have occurred during his or her incarceration as a result of an act or omission of the Department or any of its agents, former officers, employees or contractors. The claim must be filed within 6 months after the date of the alleged loss, damage or injury. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

The Office of the Ombudsperson for Offenders is hereby established within the Department to promote and protect the health, safety and welfare of offenders and prepare offenders for successful reentry into communities upon release. The Office must be impartial and operationally independent of the Department. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
The Board shall appoint the Ombudsperson and may enter into a contract with a person to serve as Ombudsperson. The Ombudsperson serves at the pleasure of the Board. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

Propose policy or procedural changes to the Department relating to any systemic issue identified by the Ombudsperson. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

If the Ombudsperson has reason to believe that a violation of a state or federal law or a constitutional provision has occurred or is occurring, the Ombudsperson shall notify the Director. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Except as otherwise provided in subsection 6, the Ombudsperson shall: ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

Prepare an annual report, which must include, without limitation: ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

Information concerning grievances entered into NOTIS for the immediately preceding year, which must include: ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ (I) The total number of grievances filed during the immediately preceding year; ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ (II) A summary of the claims included in grievances filed during the immediately preceding year; ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ (III) The total number of investigations conducted by the Department during the immediately preceding year; and ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ (IV) The outcome of each investigation conducted by the Department during the immediately preceding year; ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

Any recommendations for proposed legislation; and ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Any other information the Ombudsperson determines is appropriate to include in the report. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
The Ombudsperson shall not: ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

The Department shall provide any funds necessary to carry out the provisions of this section. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

As used in this section, ï¿½NOTISï¿½ means the Nevada Offender Tracking Information System or its successor.

Except as otherwise provided in subparagraph
of paragraph
and subsection 2, expenses for medical or dental care, prosthetic devices and pharmaceutical items; and ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

If the offender has a serious mental illness or other significant mental impairment, unless a provider of health care orders the solitary confinement for the safety of the offender, staff or any other person. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Except as otherwise provided inNRS 209.369, the Department may remove an offender from solitary confinement at any time if the offender has demonstrated good behavior. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
If an offender is placed in solitary confinement, the offender must, while placed in solitary confinement, be afforded the same privileges identified in paragraph
of subsection 5 ofNRS 209.369as are afforded to an offender placed in disciplinary segregation. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
The Department shall ensure that each offender placed in solitary confinement receives a health and welfare check conducted at least once each day by a provider of health care at his or her cell.

section.heading: Solitary confinement: Continuation of placement of offender in solitary confinement; limitations; review of and individualized treatment plan for offender; removal of offender from solitary confinement upon request; report; recording of review; retention of certain documents.

content.p: The Department may continue to keep an offender placed in solitary confinement for more than 15 days if: ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
A provider of health care recommends that the offender be kept in solitary confinement due to medical necessity; or ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

A multidisciplinary team recommends a continuation of solitary confinement for the offender after a determination from the review conducted pursuant to subsection 3 that the offender presents a threat to the safety or health of other offenders or correctional staff. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
The continuation of solitary confinement of an offender pursuant to paragraph

of subsection 1 must not exceed an additional period of 15 consecutive days, after which the offender must be removed from solitary confinement and the multidisciplinary team shall determine whether a return to solitary confinement is necessary. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

A multidisciplinary team shall conduct a review of each offender placed in solitary confinement and shall develop an individualized treatment plan for the offender before the offender is removed from solitary confinement. The treatment plan may contain, without limitation, recommendations relating to staff intervention, housing placement in the facility or institution and any other recommendations that the multidisciplinary team deems appropriate. If required by exigent circumstances, a member of the multidisciplinary team who is unable to be present for the review may, through remote communication: ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Attend the review; and ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Participate in any discussion concerning the review of the offender. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
If an offender is kept in solitary confinement pursuant to paragraph
of subsection 1 and, at any time, requests removal from solitary confinement, the offender must be removed from solitary confinement within 24 hours after the request for removal. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

If an offender is kept in solitary confinement for a period of more than 15 consecutive days pursuant to this section, the multidisciplinary team must submit a report to the Director within 24 hours after the determination to continue solitary confinement, and every 15 days thereafter during which the offender remains in solitary confinement, which must include, without limitation: ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
The name of the offender; ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
A description of the reasons for the continuation of solitary confinement; and ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Any plan developed for the removal of the offender from solitary confinement. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

Any meeting or discussion concerning the review conducted pursuant to subsection 3 or a determination to continue solitary confinement for an offender pursuant to this section must be: ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Kept by the Department for at least 1 year. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
As used in this section: ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
ï¿½Mental health clinicianï¿½ means: ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
A psychiatrist licensed to practice medicine in this State and certified by the American Board of Psychiatry and Neurology; ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

A social worker who: ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ (I) Is licensed in this State as a clinical social worker; ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ (II) Holds a masterï¿½s degree in social work; and ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ (III) Is employed by the Department; ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

A registered nurse who: ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ (I) Is licensed to practice professional nursing in this State; ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ (II) Holds a masterï¿½s degree in the field of psychiatric nursing; and ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ (III) Is employed by the Department; ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
A marriage and family therapist licensed pursuant tochapter 641Aof NRS; or ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
A clinical professional counselor licensed pursuant tochapter 641Aof NRS. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
ï¿½Multidisciplinary teamï¿½ means a team which must consist of the following persons: ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
A mental health clinician; ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
A case worker; ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
A correctional supervisor; ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
An associate warden; and ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Any other staff member deemed necessary by the Director.

section.heading: Limitation on imposition of disciplinary segregation; placement in solitary confinement for safety of offender; procedure for imposition of disciplinary segregation; requirement for psychological evaluation; request for release; conditions of disciplinary segregation.

content.p: The Department or a private facility or institution shall not place an offender in disciplinary segregation unless the offender is found guilty of an infraction after: ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Notice and a hearing pursuant to subsection 3; and ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
If applicable, a psychological evaluation pursuant to subsection 4. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

An offender who is confined in an institution or facility of the Department or a private facility or institution may request placement in solitary confinement to protect his or her safety. The Department or private facility or institution shall not place such an offender in solitary confinement unless: ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

The Department or private facility or institution performs an independent assessment of the threat to the offender and determines that the placement in solitary confinement is necessary to protect the safety of the offender; and ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
The offender is placed in solitary confinement only for the duration of the threat. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

Upon the filing of a disciplinary action against an offender that may result in the sanction of disciplinary segregation of the offender, the Department or private facility or institution shall: ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

Serve written notice of the charges against the offender which sets forth the reasons for the filing of the disciplinary action against the offender and a notice that the offender may appeal any discipline or punishment imposed on the offender as a result of a hearing unless the offender has agreed to a bargained plea. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

Hold a hearing concerning the charges against the offender not later than 15 days after the alleged violation or not later than 15 days after the completion of the investigation of the alleged violation, whichever is later. A hearing held pursuant to this paragraph must be presided over by an officer or employee of the Department or private facility or institution who has no direct involvement in the incident constituting an alleged violation. At the hearing, the offender must be allowed to present documentary evidence germane to the alleged violation and to call one or more witnesses with substantive, relevant knowledge of the issues involved in the alleged violation except for a witness who has been discharged, who is not located at the facility or institution where the hearing is being conducted or who poses a threat to safety or security at the hearing. The presiding officer or employee may find that the offender committed an infraction of the rules of the institution or facility only if he or she finds, based on the evidence presented at the hearing, that there is evidence that the infraction occurred and that the offender more likely than not committed the infraction. The presiding officer or employee must provide to the offender a written statement of the evidence supporting the determination of the presiding officer or employee unless providing such a written statement would jeopardize the safety or security of the institution or facility or the safety of the staff or offenders in the institution or facility. That presiding officer or employee shall not sanction an offender to disciplinary segregation for a fixed period. Any period for which the offender is sanctioned to disciplinary segregation must be expressed in terms of the maximum number of days the offender may be subjected to disciplinary segregation. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

The Department or private facility or institution must refer the offender for a psychological evaluation before holding a hearing pursuant to subsection 3 if, at any stage of the disciplinary process set forth in subsection 3: ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
It is known or suspected that a mental health condition or medical condition of the offender was a substantial cause of the alleged violation; ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
The offender is assigned to a mental health program of the Department or private facility or institution; or ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

The offender has been diagnosed as seriously mentally ill. ï¿½If, during the psychological evaluation, the staff of the Department or private facility or institution has reason to believe that the alleged violation by the offender may have been the result of a medical condition of the offender, including, without limitation, dementia, Alzheimerï¿½s disease, post-traumatic stress disorder or traumatic brain injury, the staff of the Department or private facility or institution must refer the offender to the medical staff of the institution or facility for a medical review and recommendation before holding a hearing pursuant to subsection 3. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
If the sanction of disciplinary segregation is imposed on an offender, the offender: ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

May, after serving one-half of the period for which the offender is sanctioned to disciplinary segregation, petition the warden of the institution or facility for removal from disciplinary segregation if the offender has demonstrated good behavior. The offender must be advised that he or she may petition the warden pursuant to this paragraph. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Must, while subject to disciplinary segregation, be: ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Served the same meal and ration as is provided to offenders in general population unless the offender is placed on a special diet for health or religious reasons; ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Permitted a minimum of at least 5 hours of exercise per week, unless doing so would present a threat to the safety or security of the institution or facility; ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Given access to reading materials; and ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Given access to materials from the law library in the institution or facility. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

The period for which an offender may be held in disciplinary segregation must be the minimum time required to address the disciplinary sanction or threat of harm to the offender, staff or any other person or to the security of the institution or facility, as defined by the regulations adopted by the Board. Such a period must not exceed 15 consecutive days, unless a determination is made to keep an offender placed in solitary confinement pursuant to subsection 1 ofNRS 209.3685. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

On or before December 31 of each year, the Department shall submit a report concerning the use of solitary confinement by the Department and private facilities and institutions to the Director of the Legislative Counsel Bureau for transmittal to the next session of the Legislature, if the report is submitted during an even-numbered year, or the Joint Interim Standing Committee on the Judiciary, if the report is submitted in an odd-numbered year. The report must include, without limitation, the following information, provided in the aggregate and without any personally identifiable information: ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
The number of offenders placed in solitary confinement, in total and disaggregated by race, ethnicity, sexual orientation, age and gender identity or expression. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
The periods of time, and the number of offenders for each such period, for which offenders were placed in solitary confinement. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
The number of offenders who were placed in solitary confinement for a period of more than 15 days and a summary of the reasons for such placement.

section.heading: Corporal punishment and inhumane treatment prohibited.

content.p: Corporal punishment and inhumane treatment of offenders are prohibited.

section.heading: Care of offender who is pregnant: Access to certain services required; adoption of certain policies concerning care of offenders who are pregnant required; regulations.

content.p: The Department shall provide an offender who is pregnant and in the custody of the Department access to necessary medical and behavioral health care services, including, without limitation, obstetrical services. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

Subject to the approval of the Director, the warden of each institution and the manager of each facility shall adopt a policy for the prenatal and postnatal care of offenders. Any such policy must be consistent with any other applicable laws or regulations. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
A policy adopted pursuant to subsection 2 must include, without limitation: ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
A requirement that each offender who is pregnant receive: ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

Training, educational programming or written materials concerning prenatal care, pregnancy, hygiene and health concerns relating to pregnancy, the impact of alcohol and drugs on a fetus, labor, the care of newborns and the postpartum period; ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
A diet containing the nutrients necessary to maintain a healthy pregnancy, as deemed necessary by the Medical Director; ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Any hygiene products which are reasonably necessary and specifically designed for a person who is pregnant; and ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
A requirement that each offender who delivers a baby while in the custody of the Department: ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Receives appropriate, trauma-informed medical care at the institution or facility, including, without limitation, treatment for postpartum depression; ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Receives counseling regarding parenting skills upon the request of the offender; and ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
To be provided an opportunity to bond with a baby delivered while in the custody of the Department for a minimum period of not less than 72 hours after delivery. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
The counseling and written materials required by subsection 3 must be communicated or written in easily understood language. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

The Department shall develop and adopt a policy to be carried out in each institution and facility concerning the physical and mental health of offenders who are pregnant. In developing such a policy, the Department shall take into consideration the impact of certain actions on the offender and the fetus, including, without limitation, the impact of: ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
The use of restraints; and ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
An invasive body cavity search. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
The Department shall adopt any regulations necessary to carry out the provisions of this section. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Nothing in this section shall be construed to require an institution or facility to adopt any policy that does not comply with federal law or regulation.

section.heading: Care of offender who is pregnant: Limitations on use of restraints on offender who is in labor, delivering her baby or in the postpartum period; report.

content.p: No restraints of any kind may be used on an offender who is in labor, delivering her baby or in the postpartum period, unless there are compelling reasons to believe that the offender presents: ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
A serious and immediate threat of harm to herself, staff or others; or ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
A substantial flight risk and cannot be reasonably confined by other means. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

If an offender who is in labor, delivering her baby or in the postpartum period is restrained, only the least restrictive restraints which are necessary to ensure safety and security may be used. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

A correctional staff member who orders the use of restraints on an offender who is pregnant or in the postpartum period shall submit a written report to the warden of the institution or manager of the facility. The report must: ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Describe the reasons for the use of the restraints on the offender; and ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Be submitted to the warden or manager within 5 hours after the use of the restraints. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
As used in this section: ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

ï¿½Postpartum periodï¿½ means the period of time an offender is recuperating from delivering a baby, as determined by the physician of the offender, immediately following delivery and directly related to the birth, including the period an offender is in a hospital or infirmary after birth. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

ï¿½Restraintsï¿½ means any physical restraint or mechanical device used to control the movement of the limbs of a person, including, without limitation, flex cuffs, soft restraints, hard metal handcuffs, a black box, Chubb cuffs, leg irons, belly chains, a security tether chain or a convex shield.

section.heading: Diet, housing and hygiene of offenders; medical and dental services of institutions and facilities.

content.p: Each offender in an institution or facility of the Department must be provided a healthful diet and appropriate, sanitary housing. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
The Director with the approval of the Board shall establish standards for personal hygiene of offenders and for the medical and dental services of each institution or facility.

section.heading: Access to prescription medication.

content.p: If the prescription is new, the prescription is transmitted to a licensed pharmacy and filled as soon as possible; or ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
If the prescription is a refill, the prescription is refilled on or before the date on which the current supply of the prescription medication is exhausted.
The Department shall ensure that each offender: ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Completes a medical release of information form at the time of intake; and ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Has the ability to update a completed medical release of information form as necessary. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

If an offender in the custody of the Department is hospitalized for or diagnosed with a critical medical condition which requires the offender to stay in a medical facility overnight, the Department shall, within 24 hours after such hospitalization or diagnosis, attempt to inform all persons authorized by the current medical release of information form about the health status of the offender. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

If an offender in the custody of the Department is hospitalized for or diagnosed with a critical medical condition which does not require the offender to stay in a medical facility overnight, the Department shall, within 4 hours after the return of the offender to the institution or facility at which the offender is incarcerated, provide the offender with the opportunity to make a telephone call to a friend, relative or other person to inform the person about the health status of the offender. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
As used in this section: ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
ï¿½Critical medical conditionï¿½ means a condition diagnosed by a provider of health care that: ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Is terminal; ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Involves extreme physical illness, including, without limitation, an extreme physical illness resulting from a drug or alcohol overdose. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
ï¿½Drug or alcohol overdoseï¿½ has the meaning ascribed to it inNRS 453C.150. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
ï¿½Medical facilityï¿½ has the meaning ascribed to it inNRS 449.0151.

section.heading: Autopsy of offenders.

content.p: Consents to the autopsy; or ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Does not notify the Director of any objection to the autopsy within 72 hours after the death.

section.heading: Care of women in custody: Completion of form at intake; access to certain services; provision of feminine hygiene products; regulations.

content.p: The Department shall ensure that each woman who is assigned to an institution or facility completes a form at the time of intake to assess the needs of the woman while in the custody of the Department. The form must include, without limitation, questions relating to: ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
How recently the woman has received preventative gynecological care and, if applicable, obstetrical care; and ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
The needs of the woman for feminine hygiene products for the purpose of providing the woman with a suitable supply of feminine hygiene products. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
The Department shall provide a woman who is in the custody of the Department access to necessary medical and behavioral health care services, including: ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Any appropriate follow-up care necessary for a woman who receives an examination pursuant to paragraph
. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

The Department shall provide a woman who is in the custody of the Department with a sufficient supply of feminine hygiene products at no cost. The Department shall provide the woman with a preferred type of feminine hygiene products upon request. A woman may at any time inform the Department of a need to adjust the supply of feminine hygiene products necessary to constitute a sufficient supply for the needs of the woman. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
The Department shall adopt regulations necessary to carry out the provisions of this section. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
As used in this section: ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
ï¿½Feminine hygiene productï¿½ means a sanitary napkin, tampon or other similar item used during a menstrual cycle. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
ï¿½Mammographyï¿½ has the meaning ascribed to it inNRS 457.182.

section.heading: Chief Medical Officer to examine and report on medical and dental services, diet of offenders, sanitation and safety in institutions and facilities.

content.p: The Chief Medical Officer shall periodically examine and shall report to the Board semiannually upon the following operations of the Department: ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
The medical and dental services and places where they are provided, based upon the standards for medical facilities as provided inchapter 449of NRS. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

The nutritional adequacy of the diet of incarcerated offenders taking into account the religious or medical dietary needs of an offender and the adjustment of dietary allowances for age, sex and level of activity. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
The sanitation, healthfulness, cleanliness and safety of its various institutions and facilities. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
The Board shall take appropriate action to remedy any deficiencies reported pursuant to subsection 1.

section.heading: Order by court affecting conditions of confinement of prisoner; Director entitled to notice and opportunity to be heard; exception.

content.p: Except as otherwise provided in subsection 2, a court issuing an order at the request of a prisoner in a state prison that affects the conditions of confinement of the prisoner shall provide the Director with: ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Sufficient prior notice of the intention of the court to enter the order; and ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
An opportunity to be heard on the issue. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

The court is not required to provide the Director with prior notice pursuant to subsection 1 if the prisoner has commenced an action with the court challenging the conditions of his or her confinement and has served a copy of the action on the Director and the Attorney General. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

As used in this section, ï¿½conditions of confinementï¿½ include, without limitation, the access of a prisoner to the resources of a law library, the privileges of a prisoner to receive visitors and to use a telephone, the type of meals provided to the prisoner, the place of confinement of a prisoner and the provision of medical care to a prisoner in a situation that is not an emergency.

section.heading: Legislative findings and declarations regarding programs for education of offenders.

content.p: The Legislature finds and declares that the program for general education of offenders and the program of education of offenders in English as a second language are acts of grace of the State. No offender has a right to participate in such a program, and it is not intended that the establishment of such programs create any such right or interest in liberty or property or establish a basis for any cause of action against the State, its political subdivisions, agencies, boards, commissions, departments, officers or employees.

section.heading: Board to establish programs for general education, vocational education and training and other rehabilitation.

content.p: The Board shall establish by regulation programs of general education, vocational education and training and other rehabilitation for offenders. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
The regulations must take appropriate account of the following matters: ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
The educational level and needs of offenders; ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Interests of offenders; and ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
The number of offenders desiring participation in such programs. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
The regulations must provide for an assessment of these programs at least every 3 years by qualified persons, professional groups or trade associations. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

No offender has a right to be admitted to a program of education, vocational education and training or other rehabilitation programs established pursuant to this section, and it is not intended that the establishment of such programs or the failure to establish such programs creates any right or interest in liberty or property or establishes a basis for any cause of action against the State, its political subdivisions, agencies, boards, commissions, departments officers or employees.

section.heading: Director to administer programs of education, training and rehabilitation, to establish programs for counseling, research, statistics and planning and to purchase textbooks.

content.p: Establish programs to provide medical, psychological, psychiatric and other appropriate forms of counseling to offenders under the jurisdiction of the Department in accordance with classification requirements. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Administer programs of general education, vocational training and other rehabilitation for offenders established by the Board. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

Within the limits of legislative appropriations, purchase textbooks for use by offenders who are enrolled in courses of general education and vocational training offered by any branch or facility of the Nevada System of Higher Education. Any textbooks purchased pursuant to this section must remain the property of the State and must be reissued to offenders as appropriate. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Within the limits of legislative appropriations, establish programs of research, statistics and planning to: ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Determine and review periodically the effectiveness of the Departmentï¿½s programs of education, vocational training and other rehabilitation for offenders; ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Provide annually, and at other times when so requested, to the Board, the Governor and the Legislature information pertaining to: ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
The effectiveness of those programs in accomplishing their purposes; and ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
The number of offenders who are returned to prison after their release; and ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Effect appropriate changes in the programs established by the Board.

section.heading: Residential confinement: Duration; notification to victim; eligibility; violation of terms or conditions; status; restitution.

section.heading: Regulations regarding literacy of offenders.

content.p: Designate a level of literacy in reading and writing which is consistent with that required by the State Board of Education for its pupils in the eighth grade. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Provide for the testing of each offender when he or she first becomes incarcerated, and as often as needed thereafter, to determine his or her ability to read and write. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Establish guidelines for evaluating the progress of an illiterate offender in an educational program. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Establish a course to teach English as a second language, if necessary. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Are necessary to carry out the provisions of this section andNRS 209.396.

section.heading: Limitations on assignment of offender to industrial or vocational school; educational requirements for offender with developmental, learning or other disability.

content.p: Except as otherwise provided in this section, an offender who is illiterate may not be assigned to an industrial or a vocational program unless: ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
The offender is regularly attending and making satisfactory progress in a program for general education; or ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
The Director for good cause determines that the limitation on assignment should be waived under the circumstances with respect to a particular offender. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
An offender whose: ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Native language is not English; ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Ability to read and write in his or her native language is at or above the level of literacy designated by the Board in its regulations; and ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

Ability to read and write the English language is below the level of literacy designated by the Board in its regulations, ï¿½may not be assigned to an industrial or a vocational program unless the offender is regularly attending and making satisfactory progress in a course which teaches English as a second language or the Director for good cause determines that the limitation on assignment should be waived under the circumstances with respect to a particular offender. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Upon written documentation that an illiterate offender has a developmental, learning or other similar disability which affects his or her ability to learn, the Director may: ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

The provisions of this section do not apply to an offender who presents satisfactory evidence that the offender has a: ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

section.heading: Director may establish facilities for offenders to live in community.

content.p: The Director may, with the approval of the Board, establish facilities which enable offenders to live in a community while obtaining regular employment, enrolling in academic courses, participating in vocational training programs, utilizing community resources in meeting their personal and family needs, and participating in whatever other approved programs may exist within the community.

Appearing in court; ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

The regulations adopted by the Director pursuant to subsections 2 and 3 must: ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

ï¿½Authorized telecommunications deviceï¿½ means a device authorized for use by an offender in accordance with the regulations adopted pursuant to this section. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
